title: Linear Algebra & Calculus

units.title: Introduction to Linear Algebra
topics: Gauss-Jordan reduction and inverse of matrices
Linear dependence and independence of vectors
Consistency and Solution of linear system of equations

units.title: Differential Calculus
topics: Partial Differentiation and its geometrical interpretation
Taylor‘s and Maclaurin‘s series (for one and two variables)
Maxima and minima of functions of two variables

units.title: Vector Calculus (Differential)
topics: Osculating plane, Normal plane, Rectifying plane
Gradient, Divergence and Curl and their Physical Interpretation
Del applied twice to point function
Del applied to products of point functions

units.title: Vector Calculus (Integral)
topics: Theorems of Green, Stokes and Gauss (without proofs)
Verifications and applications of vector theorems

refbooks.title: Thomas' Calculus
refbooks.authors: G.B. Thomas, M.D. Weir, J. Hass

outcomes: Understand and analyze the theoretical & practical aspects of matrices and calculus.
Solve systems of linear equations using multiple methods, demonstrate understanding of linear independence, and determine eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
Understand the various solution techniques and practical aspects of differential and Integral calculus.
Familiar understanding with the basic concepts of differential geometry and the application of vector differentiation and integration to solve real time surface, area and volume problems.
Apply the concepts of matrices and calculus in various engineering problems.

title: Engineering Physics

units.title: Interference & Diffraction
topics: Interference by division of amplitude and wavefront
Single slit and double slit diffraction

units.title: Fiber Optics and Photonics
topics: Optical Fiber: physical structure and basic theory
Step index and graded index fibers

outcomes: Describe the optical devices and their applications.
Apply Maxwell’s equations to electrodynamic systems.
Understand semiconductor physics for electronic systems.
Use quantum mechanics to solve nanoscale problems.
Interpret equipment and results based on physical phenomena.

title: Physics Lab

units.title: Experiments
topics: Specific resistance using post office box
Magnetic field variation via circular coil

outcomes: Handle equipment and record measurements accurately.
Understand physical principles experimentally.
Use systems and instruments for precise measurement.
Work in teams and communicate results effectively.

title: Introduction to Computer and C Programming

textbooks.title: C Programming Language
textbooks.authors: Brian W. Kernighan and Dennis Ritchie

refbooks.title: A Structured Programming Approach in C
refbooks.authors: Behrouz A. Forouzan and Richard F. Gilberg

outcomes: Understand components and functioning of computers.
Design algorithms and flowcharts.
Write and debug C programs.
Use data structures and control structures in C.

title: Basics of Mechanical Engineering

units.title: Stress and Strain
topics: Bending and torsion of beams and shafts

textbooks.title: Basics of Mechanical Engineering
textbooks.authors: R.K. Singal, M. Singal, R. Singal

outcomes: Understand thermodynamics and energy systems.
Understand IC engine types and cycles.
Identify suitable materials for applications.
Understand machining and manufacturing processes.
Analyze mechanical structures for stress and strain.

title: Communication Skills

refbooks.title: The Definitive Book of Body Language

outcomes: Understand and apply communication theory in English.
Listen, read, and speak effectively in academic/professional contexts.
Analyze verbal and non-verbal communication.
Write clear and concise technical and formal documents.

title: Human Values and Ethical Mindfulness

units.title: Introduction to Value Education
topics: Purpose and motivation for value education
Need, content and process of value education

textbooks.title: A Foundation Course in Human Values and Professional Ethics
textbooks.authors: R.R. Gaur, R. Sangal and G.P. Bagaria

outcomes: Understand human aspirations and their fulfillment through right understanding.
Develop sensitivity and competence for effective participation in society.
Apply value-based living in personal and professional domains.

title: Differential Equations
outcomes: Solve first-order and higher-order differential equations.
Apply Laplace transform techniques to solve differential equations.
Analyze systems of linear differential equations using matrix methods.

title: Introduction to Python and Data Structures
outcomes: Write basic programs using Python.
Use control structures and functions effectively.
Work with built-in data structures.
Implement file handling and recursion in programs.

title: Basic Electrical Engineering

units.title: Transformers and Machines
topics: Construction and working of single-phase transformer

outcomes: Understand the fundamentals of electrical circuits.
Analyze DC and AC circuits using network theorems.
Comprehend working principles of electrical machines and transformers.

title: Basic Electronics Engineering

units.title: Electronic Circuits
topics: Amplifiers: common emitter and common source configurations

outcomes: Understand the behavior of semiconductor devices.
Analyze basic analog and digital circuits.
Apply electronics knowledge in electrical and computer applications.

title: Energy, Environment and Life Science

units.title: Natural Resources and Biodiversity
topics: Forest, water, mineral and energy resources

units.title: Environmental Pollution
topics: Air, water, soil and noise pollution
Nuclear hazards and solid waste management

refbooks.title: Principles of Environmental Science and Engineering

outcomes: Understand ecosystem dynamics and biodiversity.
Assess resource utilization and pollution impact.
Apply sustainable practices for environment protection.

title: Entrepreneurship and Marketing Dynamics
outcomes: Develop entrepreneurial skills and business acumen.
Understand marketing strategies and customer engagement.
Gain exposure to the startup ecosystem.

title: Electrical & Electronics Engineering Lab

units.title: Experiments
topics: Verification of Ohm's Law and Kirchhoff's Laws
Logic gate verification and combinational circuits

outcomes: Perform basic electrical and electronics experiments.
Interpret results using standard methods.
Understand the characteristics of electrical/electronic components.

title: Engineering Chemistry

units.title: Atomic and Molecular Structure
topics: Molecular orbitals of homonuclear diatomic molecules

units.title: Intermolecular Forces and Potential Energy Surfaces
topics: Ionic, dipolar and van der Waals interactions

outcomes: Understand atomic structure and chemical bonding.
Interpret molecular interactions and spectroscopy data.
Apply principles of stereochemistry and phase equilibria.
Analyze polymer chemistry and corrosion mechanisms.

title: Engineering Chemistry Lab
outcomes: Develop experimental skills in basic chemistry.
Analyze and interpret chemical data.
Perform accurate and safe laboratory practices.

title: Engineering Graphics
outcomes: Understand basic principles of engineering graphics.
Draw orthographic and isometric views of objects.
Visualize objects in 2D and 3D projections.
Interpret and create technical drawings for engineering use.

title: Engineering Workshop Practice

units.title: Fitting Shop
topics: Filing, sawing, marking and fitting practice

units.title: Carpentry Shop
topics: Making joints like dovetail, lap and mortise-tenon

units.title: Welding Shop
topics: Simple weld joints and bead formation

units.title: Sheet Metal and Smithy
topics: Simple shapes using mallets and stakes
Smithy operations using hammering and forming

units.title: Machine Shop Introduction
topics: Demonstration of lathe, drilling, shaping machines

outcomes: Identify and use various workshop tools and machines.
Perform fitting, carpentry, welding, and sheet metal operations.
Understand the basic manufacturing processes through hands-on practice.

title: Communication Skills Lab

units.title: Listening and Speaking Practice
topics: Listening to audio and video materials for comprehension

textbooks.title: English Language Communication Skills Lab Manual

outcomes: Improve English pronunciation, fluency, and clarity.
Participate effectively in group discussions and interviews.
Enhance reading and writing skills in a professional context.
Use language lab tools to develop communication competence.
